abstract.p: This proposal provides a module comprising a set of functions for manipulation of PDF documents. It has been designed to be compatible with XQuery 3.0 and XSLT 3.0, as well as any other standard based on XPath 3.0.

status.p: Must be ignored, but is required by the schema...

div1.head: Introduction
div1.p: This module allows manipulation of PDF documents.

div2.head: Namespace conventions
div2.p: The module defined by this document defines functions and elements in the namespace http://expath.org/ns/pdf. In this document, the pdf prefix, when used, is bound to this namespace URI.
Error codes are defined in the namespace http://expath.org/ns/error. In this document, err prefix, when used, is bound to this namespace URI.

div2.head: Error management
div2.p: Error conditions are identified by a code (a QName). When such an error condition is reached during the execution of the function, a dynamic error is thrown, with the corresponding error code (as if the standard XPath function error had been called).

div1.head: Creation
div1.p: These functions are for creation of PDF documents.

div2.head: The pdf:create() Function
div2.p: This function is used for creating a PDF document.

div2.head: The pdf:create-page() Function
div2.p: This function is used for creating a PDF page.

div1.head: Content
div1.p: These functions are for manipulation of content of the PDF documents.

div2.head: The pdf:merge() Function
div2.p: This function is used for merging multiple PDF documents or subsets of them (groups of pages).
div2.eg: pdf:merge($document as xs:anyAtomicType, $new-resource-metadata as element(pdf:resource-metadata) as xs:anyAtomicType

div2.head: The pdf:split() Function
div2.p: This function is used for splitting a PDF document into a number of sections. It outputs a sequence of pages (or documents? - TBD).
There can be many options for splitting: content splitting, splitting on bookmarks, extract until text.
div2.eg: pdf:split($document as xs:base64Binary, $options as element(pdf:options)) as xs:base64Binary+

item.p: $document is the PDF document to be splitted.
$options are the options for the current operation.
the pdf:split-delimiter child element specifies the delimiter used for splitting the input PDF document.
the pdf:output-filename child element is the name of the outputted PDF file.

div2.head: The pdf:extract-pages() Function
div2.p: This function is used for extracting pages from a PDF document. It has a parameter for setting the deletion of the respective pages after extraction. It returns the extracted pages.

div2.head: The pdf:insert-pages() Function
div2.p: This function is used for inserting pages into a PDF document.

div2.head: The pdf:delete-pages() Function
div2.p: This function is used for deleting pages from a PDF document.

div2.head: The pdf:rotate-pages() Function
div2.p: This function is used for rotating pages of a PDF document.

div2.head: The pdf:revert-pages() Function
div2.p: This function is used for reverting pages of a PDF document.

div1.head: Links and bookmarks
div1.p: These functions are for manipulation of links and bookmarks of a PDF document.

div2.head: The pdf:create-bookmark() Function
div2.p: This function is used to create bookmarks in a PDF document.

div2.head: The pdf:edit-bookmark() Function
div2.p: This function is used to edit bookmarks of a PDF document.

div2.head: The pdf:delete-bookmark() Function
div2.p: This function is used to delete bookmarks from a PDF document.

div2.head: The pdf:import-bookmarks() Function
div2.p: This function is used to import bookmarks to a PDF document.

div2.head: The pdf:export-bookmarks() Function
div2.p: This function is used to export bookmarks from a PDF document.

div2.head: The pdf:create-link() Function
div2.p: This function is used to create links in a PDF document.

div2.head: The pdf:edit-link() Function
div2.p: This function is used to edit links of a PDF document.

div2.head: The pdf:delete-link() Function
div2.p: This function is used to delete links from a PDF document.

div2.head: The pdf:import-links() Function
div2.p: This function is used to import links to a PDF document.

div2.head: The pdf:export-links() Function
div2.p: This function is used to export links from a PDF document.

div1.head: Form controls
div1.p: These functions are designated for gathering information about and interacting with form controls of a PDF document.

div1.head: Stamping, commenting, annotating, and marking
div1.p: These functions are associating various objects with a PDF document.

div2.head: The pdf:stamp() Function
div2.p: This function is used for applying a stamp to a PDF document.

div1.head: Content rasterization
div1.p: These functions are for rendering the PDF documents.

div2.head: The pdf:to-image() Function
div2.p: This function is used for converting a PDF document to images.

div1.head: Validation
div1.p: These functions are designated for validating a PDF document.

div2.head: The pdf:validate() Function
div2.p: This function is used for validating a PDF document.

div2.head: The pdf:validate-links() Function
div2.p: This function is used for validating the links contained by a PDF document.

div2.head: The pdf:validate-bookmarks() Function
div2.p: This function is used for validating the bookmarks contained by a PDF document.

div1.head: Optimization
div1.p: These functions are designated for optimizing a PDF document.

div2.head: The pdf:optimize()() Function
div2.p: This function is used for optimizing a PDF document, by reducing the file size without affecting quality.

div2.head: The pdf:linearize() Function
div2.p: This function is used for linearizing a PDF document, for fast delivery over a network. The first page is already visible, while the rest is downloaded in background

div2.head: The pdf:compress() Function
div2.p: This function is used for compressing a PDF document.

div2.head: The pdf:uncompress() Function
div2.p: This function is used for uncompressing a PDF document.

div1.head: Security
div1.p: These functions are for protection of the PDF documents.

div2.head: The pdf:encrypt() Function
div2.p: This function is used for encrypting a PDF document by using a digital certificate.

div2.head: The pdf:decrypt() Function
div2.p: This function is used for decrypting a PDF document.

div2.head: The pdf:add-signature() Function
div2.p: This function is used for adding an electronic signature to a PDF document.

div2.head: The pdf:remove-signature() Function
div2.p: This function is used for removing an electronic signature from a PDF document.

div1.head: Repairing
div1.p: These functions are for repairing and recovering of PDF documents.

div2.head: The pdf:repair() Function
div2.p: This function is used for repairing a PDF document.

div1.head: Scenarios of usage
div1.p: Some scenarios of usage of the functions comprised by this module.

div2.head: Insert a (blank) page every nth page
Delete broken links
div2.eg: for $broken-link in pdf:validate-links($pdf-document) return if () then () else ()

div2.head: Audit Bookmarks and Links
div2.p: One can validate bookmarks and links, and export those found broken. They can be included in report and/or fixed and imported to document.

div2.head: Validate PDf document
div2.p: One can validate a PDf document using certain validation criteria, as such: dimensions of all/certain pages should be A4 (297 mm * 210 mm), there should be no content within a certain rectangular area of a page (left margin where the print shop inserts a bar code, for instance), number of pages should be less than N, PDF version used.
